alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 5:47PM EDT until June 29 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT/815 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING FOR EASTERN GIBSON AND PIKE COUNTIES... At 447 PM CDT /547 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated the heaviest rain had moved out of the area. However, water may be slow to recede due to excessive rainfall amounts of 4 to 6 inches that occurred today. One station west of Petersburg has picked up 6.43" since 7 AM! Flash flooding remains likely. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Princeton, Oakland City, Petersburg, Winslow, Patoka, Francisco, Somerville, Hazleton, Spurgeon and Mackey. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
